WRITING.TITLE: Blender won't let me select individual objects in Object mode?
WRITING.TEXT: When I right click, it selects each of my objects. I can't move them anywhere unless I want to move all of them.
I suck at character modeling. How did you get good at it?

WRITING.TITLE: Which is better for character modeling? Blender or Maya?
WRITING.TEXT: Blender kicks ass at creating stuff like planes and materials. But sucks at character creation.

WRITING.TITLE: Links to free, downloadable, high-poly base meshes?
WRITING.TEXT: If we had a good list of links, it would be good for new users like myself.

WRITING.TITLE: Noob question: Rather than hitting ctrl tab and clicking on vertices/edges/faces every time, what shortcut can I use so that I can just cycle through vertices/edges/faces?
Does Maya's Mentalray have better particle rendering than element 3d?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm using AE, blender, and maya. And I don't feel like cycling through softwares. I was impressed by element 3d.
Great man. Thanks

WRITING.TITLE: Maya comes with Mentalray right?
WRITING.TEXT: Just wondering. I need a renderer.

WRITING.TITLE: Sites like user testing?
WRITING.TEXT: Usertesting is pretty good. $10-15 per test.

WRITING.TEXT: Also, what other sites could I use?

WRITING.TITLE: Maya keyboard shortcuts?
WRITING.TEXT: I saw someone who did a speed modeling video where a guy modeled a gun based of an image which he had in the background really fast. He could chose a polygon and stretch it out in less than that of a second. I'm thinking he just uses keyboard shortcuts, for that's what people do in Blender speed modeling videos. So, what keyboard shortcuts do I use to do such?

WRITING.TITLE: Can I use 3ds Max with renderman?
WRITING.TEXT: Can I just import my models into renderman and then use muh shaders to render it out?
Alright. So how do you do the "sped modeling" thing? Where one is able to stretch and select polygons very fast in blender or Maya? Do you just use the keyboard?

WRITING.TITLE: In programs like Autodesk Maya, Max, and Blender, how do you do the thing where you model off of images?
WRITING.TEXT: I saw a video where a guy created a 3d model off of an image? How does he bring the image in? How does he change the size and select shapes of polygons so fast? A simple explanation would be great?

WRITING.TITLE: What causes readers to feel emotion? tips?
WRITING.TEXT: I want my reader to feel sadness and anger. But I feel like killing characters to often becomes cliched and gimmicky. What are some tips, r/ writing?

WRITING.TITLE: [Serious] Why don't game devs become as famous for their works as movie directors do for their films?
How do you make a film plot interesting? In other words, what are some tips for keeping your audience on the edge of their seats?
WRITING.TEXT: I've worked on a few vidya games which was pretty cool, but I was completely sapped of creativity. We used CryEngine, and I realized how similar it looked to CGI movie effects. I started comparing films to video games. I asked myself, "How can a film be more interesting than a video game if a video game is so interactive and keeps the player on the edge of their seat?" Anyway, long story short, what are some nifty writing and editing tricks to keep the film vibrant, exciting, and interesting?

WRITING.TITLE: /b/ tard drinks Epsom salt
How do Christians feel about modern video games which allow you to fight satan on behalf of Jesus in the depths of Hell?
WRITING.TEXT: I was thinking Christians would feel good because you know, your hurting Satan, the ultimate sinner. Yet games such as the Diablo trilogy and Darksiders have created controversy.

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone know a good place to download the Quake 1 engine?
WRITING.TEXT: Looking for a place to download the engine used in Quake. I'm designing a retro game.

Does anyone know where I can download the engine used in Quake 1? I think it's id tech 2 or something. Anyway, I'm making a retro game, so if y'all could help me find this engine, that would be great.

WRITING.TITLE: What's it called when a planets orbit matches that of it's orbiting star's orbit?
WRITING.TEXT: One side of the planet would always have day light, another would always have constant darkness.
Okay? Where do I start? Where do I begin making an agreement with Nintendo? Also, do you have to own a company to become a dev?

WRITING.TITLE: Alright, how does an indie dev get his hands on a Wii U devkit?
WRITING.TEXT: I think R/ Nintendo would know better than anyone else. I know you need to have an agreement with Nintendo, so where do I start? How do I acquire a devkit? How do I publish my game for the Wii U?

WRITING.TITLE: How would an Indie developer get his hands on a Wii U devkit?
Alright, we need to discuss this. I'm seriously worried about us and our polygons being replaced by euclidean's unlimited detail voxel technology. Look at this video:
WRITING.TEXT:
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=5AvCxa9Y9NU
Seriously. They're releasing two games in 2015. I'm worried for CryEngine.

Voxel farm is a Voxel engine. You make shit out of billions of tiny voxels. The more voxels, the better and more round a model can be. This is supposed to solve the problem of games not being able to render enough polygons. With voxels, you can have unlimited detail, and according to Euclidean, not have to worry about hardware specs. So I'm trying to find an equally good Voxel engine without jew prices.

WRITING.TITLE: Ok, so I want to create life-like, round 3d models, how would you do this in your usual voxel engine? I don't want to have to create things voxel by voxel?
Voxel editors as good as Voxel farm but are free or reasonable in price range?
